alert.note: Alert for Lower St. Bernard (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 1:17PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern St. Bernard Parish through 145 PM CDT... At 116 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a waterspout over Lake Borgne 14 miles northeast of Shell Beach, or 22 miles south of Waveland, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Waterspouts and winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally hazardous waters. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern St. Bernard Parish. WATERSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors or to safe harbor and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
